definition: to arrive/to reach (esp. perfection)/utmost/(used in commercials)
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]
to reach day after day for
to reach the pinnacle (of artistic skill)
to attain a state of perfect governance (idiom)
famine repeats unceasingly (idiom, from Book of Songs)

sentences.english: Pierre quality, shelf-life of 20 years, to ensure consistent quality of each batch.
sentences.chinese: 优质臻品，保质20年，保证每个批次质量一致。

sentences.english: Finally, there is supreme beauty of traditional writing skill in Wang's novel.
sentences.chinese: 再次，汪曾祺小说具有臻于化境的传统技艺美。

sentences.english: The wise whitening formula can eliminate the redundant melanin and brighten the skin.
sentences.chinese: 含智能臻白配方，击退暗沉色素，均匀提亮肤色。

sentences.english: Jupiter also darts into Aries mid-year, tripling the mental energy.
sentences.chinese: 木星也会在年中时期撞入白羊，使精神能量臻至三倍。

sentences.english: Perfection is attained when the mind becomes as pure as the Atman itself.
sentences.chinese: 当心如同阿特曼本身一样纯粹时，就臻达完美。

sentences.english: Pericles was in Athens are reaching its peak.
sentences.chinese: 伯里克利当政时期雅典臻于鼎盛。

sentences.english: God does not demand that we have achieved perfection in order to love us.
sentences.chinese: 天主没有要求我们首先必须臻于完美，才爱我们。

sentences.english: Everything that I do needs to be perfect.
sentences.chinese: 我做的每件事都要臻于完美。
这些插图使正文臻于完整。

sentences.english: The study helps accredited bookkeeper to complete its system, and then improve its service quality.
sentences.chinese: 裨益记帐士制度更健全，臻而提升其服务品质。
